contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Officeholder | image = <!-- only free-content images are allowed for depicting living people - see [[WP:NONFREE]] --> | name = Neil Walter | office = [[Administrators of Tokelau|Administrator]] of [[Tokelau]] | term_start = 1988 | term_end = 1990 | primeminister = [[David Lange]], [[Geoffrey Palmer (politician)|Geoffrey Palmer]] | predecessor = H Francis | successor = Graham Ansell | term_start2 = March 1, 2003 | term_start2 = March 1, 2003 | term_end2 = 17 October 2006 | primeminister2 = [[Helen Clark]] | predecessor2 = Lindsay Watt | successor2 = [[David Payton]] | office3 = [[List of Ambassadors from New Zealand to Indonesia|Ambassador]] to [[Indonesia]] | term_start3 = 1990 | term_end3 = 1994 | primeminister3 = [[Jim Bolger]] | predecessor3 = [[Gordon Parkinson]] | successor3 = [[Tim Groser]] | office4 = [[List of Ambassadors from New Zealand to Japan|Ambassador]] to [[Japan]] | term_start4 = 1997 | term_end4 = 1999 | primeminister4 = [[Jenny Shipley]] | predecessor4 = [[Maarten Wevers]] | successor4 = [[Phillip Gibson]] | office5 = Secretary of the [[New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] | term_start5 = 1999 | term_end5 = 2002 | primeminister5 = [[Jenny Shipley]], [[Helen Clark]] | predecessor5 = [[Richard Nottage]] | successor5 = [[Simon Murdoch]] | birth_place = | birth_date = 1942 }} '''Neil Douglas Walter''', [[New Zealand Order of Merit|CNZM]] (born 1942) is a distinguished New Zealand diplomat, and is a former [[Administrators of Tokelau|Administrator]] of [[Tokelau]], a territory of [[New Zealand]]. He served from February 1988 until 1990, and again from March 1, 2003 to 17 October 2006. ==Biography== In his early career in the Foreign Service, Walter served in Thailand, New York, and Samoa. In 1981, Walter was posted to New Zealand's Embassy in Paris, where he was the New Zealand Permanent Representative to [[UNESCO]]. In 1985, Walter became New Zealand's deputy High Commissioner to London. Walter was New Zealand's Ambassador to Indonesia from 1990â€“1994, and served as New Zealand's Ambassador to Japan from 1997-1999. In 1999, Walter became Secretary of the [[New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs]], until his retirement from the diplomatic service in 2002. He was one of three people to address the [[United Nations Special Committee on Decolonization]], 10th Meeting, June 23, 2003. Walter was the Chairman of the [[Environmental Risk Management Authority]] until 2008 and currently chairs [[NZ On Air]]. He also undertakes various reviews and assessments for the NZ Government. His 2009 report on the State Services Commission's ambitious and ill-fated GSN information technology project led to the resignation of the Deputy [[State Services Commission]]er and Government CIO [[Laurence Millar]]. ==Personal life== He is married and has one son and two daughters. His brother [[David Walter (New Zealand politician)|David Walter]] of [[Stratford, New Zealand|Stratford]] is a former Chairman of the [[Taranaki Regional Council]] and mayor of the [[Stratford District Council]]. {{s-start}} {{succession box | before=[[H Francis]]| title=[[Administrator of Tokelau]] | years=1988–1990 | after=[[Graham Ansell]]}} {{succession box | before=[[Lindsay Watt]]| title=[[Administrator of Tokelau]] | years=2003–2006 | after=[[David Payton]]}} {{s-end}} ==External links== * [http://www.victoria.ac.nz/sog/fellows/Neil_Walter/index.aspx Neil Walter biography at the Victoria University of Wellington] * SSC Inquiry [http://www.ssc.govt.nz/display/document.asp?docid=7126] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Walter, Neil | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Administrator of Tokelau | DATE OF BIRTH = 1942 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Walter, Neil}} [[Category:1942 births|Walter, Neil Douglas]] [[Category:Living people|Walter, Neil Douglas]] [[Category:New Zealand diplomats|Walter, Neil Douglas]] [[Category:New Zealand public servants|Walter, Neil Douglas]] [[Category:Companions of the New Zealand Order of Merit]] [[Category:Ambassadors of New Zealand to Japan]] [[Category:Administrators of Tokelau|Walter, Neil Douglas]] [[Category:Permanent Delegates of New Zealand to UNESCO]] [[Category:Ambassadors of New Zealand to Indonesia]] {{tokelau-politician-stub}}
